intro: Canthium umbellulatum, commonly known as the false mallow, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers that are clustered in umbels. It thrives in moist, sunny habitats and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Canthium umbellulatum is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
